Slovak Prime Minister Robert Fico addresses the nation for the first time after the shooting, before the EU Parliamentary Election, in Bratislava, Slovakia, in this screengrab taken from a social media video released on June 5.

title: US - made munitions used in deadly Israeli strike on UN school in central Gaza
message:
LONDON — US-made munitions were used in a deadly Israeli airstrike on a United Nations-run school in central Gaza on Thursday where Palestinians were sheltering, a CNN analysis of video from the scene and review by an explosive weapons expert has found.
At least 45 people died in strike on the school in the Nuseirat refugee camp, a spokesperson for Gaza's Ministry of Health told CNN.
CNN identified fragments of at least two US-made GBU-39 small diameter bombs (SDB) in video filmed at the scene by a journalist working for CNN.
This incident is the second time in two weeks that CNN has been able to verify the use of US-manufactured munitions in deadly Israeli attacks on displaced Palestinians.
At least 45 people were killed and more than 200 others injured on May 26 after a fire broke out following an IDF strike on a displacement camp in Rafah, most of them women and children, according to the Gaza Health Ministry and Palestinian medics.

title: Slovakia remains bitterly divided after assassination attempt on PM
message:
SLOVAKIA: A brief political truce that emerged after Slovak Prime Minister Robert Fico was shot four times last month has given way to a bitter blame game.
The small eastern European country remains divided and tense, a week after Mr Fico was released from hospital.
The assassination attempt was the first on a Slovak leader in the nation’s 30-year history, and the first on the continent in more than two decades.
For many, the May 15 attack embodies the deep wounds of escalating polarisation that has plagued Slovakia for years.
The alleged perpetrator, identified by Slovak media as 71-year-old poet Juraj Cintula, had a patchy political history, supporting a range of parties in the country.

message:

message:

Picture: AlamyBy Emma SoteriouVladimir Putin has warned that he will send long-range missiles in striking distance of the West after several countries stepped in to helped bolster Ukraine's defensive arsenal.

However, the US still prohibits Kyiv from striking Russia with ATACMS, which have a range of up to 186 miles.

title: 39 Palestinians Killed In Israeli Airstrike On UNRWA School In Central Gaza Strip
message:
At least 39 displaced Palestinians were killed on Thursday in an Israeli airstrike on a school sheltering thousands of displaced people in the Nuseirat refugee camp, the central Gaza Strip, according to Gaza authorities.
In a statement, the Gaza-based Government Media Office said the Israeli army struck a UN agency for Palestinian refugees-run school in the Nuseirat refugee camp also leaving dozens of people injured.
It added that the Israeli army's relentless "massacres" in Gaza is proof that it continues the "genocide" of displaced Palestinians in the Gaza Strip.
The Israeli army, for its part, admitted hitting the UNRWA school in the Nuseirat refugee camp, claiming Hamas fighters were hiding inside.
Nearly eight months into the Israeli war, vast swathes of Gaza lay in ruins amid a crippling blockade of food, clean water, and medicine.

title: Zion man arrested for stabbing relative , killing family dog and child endangerment
message:
ZION, Ill. — A Zion man who ingested illegal drugs is suspected of stabbing a relative, shooting and killing his family dog and stuffing a toddler into a garbage can before being arrested by police, the department said Wednesday.
Zion police officials said around 11:15 a.m. Monday, June 3, officers responded to the area of 31st Street and Gabriel Avenue following reports of a stabbing.
Arriving officers located an 18-year-old male hiding nearby in the 1900 block of Carmel Blvd.
The stabbing victim, suffering from a non-life-threatening injury, named a relative, 22-year-old Arthur Scarborough of Zion, as the offender.
Police said after the shooting, Scarborough grabbed the 2-year-old from the home and put the toddler inside a nearby trash can.

title: INT : Ukraine strikes into Russia with US weapons for first time , official says
message:
Ukraine strikes into Russia with US weapons for first time, official says Ukraine has struck inside of Russia with U.S. weapons for the first time since permission was granted by the Biden administration last week, according to a Ukrainian official.
The Biden administration last week announced a change in policy to allow Ukraine to strike inside of Russia from the region of Kharkiv.
The reversal was only partial, allowing for strikes in Russia from Kharkiv, where Russian forces are pressing forward in a major offensive.
Ukraine is also prohibited from using the U.S.-made Army Tactical Missile System (ATACMS) or long-range artillery to hit Russia, and from hitting civilian infrastructure.
The U.S. weapons, however, will give Kyiv the ability to blunt Russian attacks from Belgorod and deal much more damage to military infrastructure.

title: Germany Scholz to give government statement on security situation
message:
German Chancellor Olaf Scholz is set to make a government statement on the country's current security situation in the lower house of parliament on Thursday, days after he gave the green light for Ukraine to use German weapons to strike targets in Russia.
The opposition then called on the German leader to explain his sudden reversal.
Left-wing politician Christian Görke said that he would have liked the chancellor to have made a statement last week "instead of announcing lonely decisions to expand the war in Ukraine."
The decision was "carefully made" with Germany's friends and allies, Scholz said.
Calls have since been growing for the government to again allow deportations to Afghanistan and Syria.

title: Putin says Russia could deploy missiles in striking distance of the West
message:
Putin says Russia could deploy missiles in striking distance of the Westreuters_tickers6 minutesBy Samia Nakhoul and Guy FaulconbridgeST PETERSBURG, Russia (Reuters) -Russian President Vladimir Putin said on Wednesday he could deploy conventional missiles within striking distance of the United States and its European allies if they allowed Ukraine to strike deeper into Russia with long-range Western weapons.
Putin also said Moscow was considering deploying similar high-technology, long-range missiles close enough to strike the states that allowed Ukraine to strike Russian territory with such missiles.
Washington still prohibits Kyiv from striking Russia with ATACMS, which have a range of up to 186 miles (300 km), and other long-range U.S.-supplied weapons.
When asked about the risk of nuclear war, Putin said Russia’s nuclear doctrine allowed the use of such weapons.
The West describes the invasion as an imperial-style land grab and has vowed to help Ukraine defeat Russian forces.

title: Germany : Scholz briefs parliament on national security – DW – 06 / 06 / 2024
message:
German Chancellor Olaf Scholz on Thursday morning addressed the lower house of parliament, the Bundestag, in a statement on national security.
Deportations: 'national security outweighs rights of individual asylum-seekers'He then addressed the contentious issue of migrant deportations.
In addressing the current situation in Ukraine Scholz called out AfD members for inappropriately and repeatedly interrupting his remarks.
Highlighting the importance of open and considered consultation with allies in the pursuit of peace, Scholz said, "I stand by this as chancellor, committed to peace and Germany's security."
Without security fear begins to grow — fear of citizens for one another, fear of external threats, fear of the future."

title: Tánaiste says count centres are  no place for intimidatory behaviour  ahead of election
message:
The Tánaiste and Minister for Foreign Affairs Micheál Martin has said there is no place for intimidatory behaviour at count centres across the country.
This week, Minister for Public Expenditure Pascal Donohoe said there could be a need for increased Garda presence at election count centres this weekend.
Ahead of the election, the Tánaiste said while there may be additional concerns around potential attacks on count centres this weekend, he believed that they were unlikely to emerge.
“There was jostling in some cases, sort of intimidatory behaviour and that has no place in a count centre."
While there may be concerns coming up to this weekend’s vote count, Mr Martin said he did not believe that would happen.

title: Ukraine Drone Strike Halts Operations At Russian Refinery
message:
Moscow, (APP - UrduPoint / Pakistan Point News - 6th Jun, 2024) A Ukrainian drone attack ignited a fire at an oil refinery in southern Russia, forcing it to halt operations, the regional governor said early Thursday, adding that there were no casualties.
In Rostov-on-Don city, dozens of emergency personnel rushed to put out the flames at the Novoshakhtinsk refinery, according to Governor Vasily Golubev.
"Following a drone strike, a fire broke out at the Novoshakhtinsk refinery," Golubev wrote on Telegram.
Another drone strike overnight destroyed an oil tank at a depot in Stary Oskol, north of the Ukrainian border, said Belgorod Region Governor Vyacheslav Gladkov.
Ukraine, which has been facing a Russian offensive since February 2022, has upped its attacks on Russian territory in recent months.

title: Israeli airstrike hits UN school in central Gaza
message:
Israel’s military carried out an airstrike Thursday on a U.N. school in central Gaza, where Palestinian health officials said at least 33 people were killed.
Israeli military spokesperson Lt Col. Peter Lerner told reporters that Israel was not aware of any civilian casualties.
The joint statement said it is time for the war to end.
About 120 of the hostages remain in Gaza, although the Israeli military says 37 of them are dead.
Israel's retaliatory bombardments and ground offensive have killed at least 36,600 people in Gaza, mostly civilians, according to the Gaza Health Ministry.

title: Hamas , Hezbollah ramp up strikes against Israeli targets
message:
Hamas, Hezbollah ramp up strikes against Israeli targetsIRNA - Islamic Republic News AgencyJun 5, 2024Tehran, IRNA -- Resistance movements in Palestine and Lebanon have stepped up their military operations against the Israeli regime amid the ongoing genocide in the Gaza Strip.
Lebanon's Hezbollah said in a statement on Wednesday that it had targeted a platform of the Israeli anti-missile system Iron Dome in the Ramot Naftali barracks with a guided missile.
Hezbollah also said it had launched a rocket strike at the Al-Samaqa outpost in the occupied Lebanese village of Kfarchouba.
The group also reported a drone strike targeting a gathering of Israeli soldiers in the Al-Baghdadi military site, causing casualties among their ranks.
Meanwhile, the al-Qassam Brigades, the military wing of Hamas, said it fired an anti-armor Al-Yassin 105 in central Gaza, taking out an Israeli military bulldozer.

title: Israel says jets targeting  Hamas compound  have hit a school in Gaza
message:
An Israeli airstrike on a school in Gaza has killed dozens of people, including children, local officials say.
Image: The body of a Palestinian killed in the Israeli strike is removed from the scene.
Pic: ReutersThe Israeli military said its fighter jets struck the school run by the United Nations agency providing aid to the Palestinians, known by the acronym UNRWA.

message:
The United States flew a long-range B-1B bomber over the Korean Peninsula yesterday [Macau time] for its first precision-guided bombing drill with South Korea in seven years, the South’s military said.
The exercise was meant to demonstrate the U.S. security commitment to South Korea and strengthen the allies’ joint defense posture, according to the South Korean Defense Ministry.
During the training, the B-1B dropped Joint Direct Attack Munitions while being escorted by South Korean jets, the first such bombing drill for a U.S. bomber since 2017, a ministry statement said.
North Korea has responded to past flights of B-1Bs and other powerful U.S. aircraft in South Korea with its own missile tests.
It also test-fired nuclear-capable weapons for a drill simulating a pre-emptive strike on South Korea, and allegedly jammed GPS navigation signals in South Korea.

title: Israel on brink of explosive clash with Hezbollah as  time running out
message:
Tensions between Israel and Hezbollah have been reaching boiling point in recent weeksIsrael has been warned "time is running out" to find a diplomatic solution to avoid an explosive escalation in its feud with Hezbollah.
Tensions have rocketed in recent days, with Hezbollah repeatedly targeting Israel with rocket strikes and Israeli politicians signalling a potential expansion of its military operations into Lebanon.
Former Israeli intelligence officer Avi Melamed told the Daily Express that recent developments suggest the ongoing feud could soon erupt into a direct clash.
Mr Melamed said: "It seems time is running out for the diplomatic efforts to cool the laddering escalations between Israel and Hezbollah on the border between Israel and Lebanon.
"Ultimately the people of Lebanon will suffer most from Iran’s imperialistic 'resistance' which seeks to hold the region hostage, Israel hostage, but most directly the Lebanese people hostage.” Israel and Hezbollah have been exchanging fire daily since a day after Hamas’ October 7 attack, which set off the war in Gaza.

title: Israel kills 39 Palestinians with airstrike targeting UNRWA school in central Gaza
message:
At least 39 displaced Palestinians were killed on Thursday in an Israeli airstrike on a school sheltering thousands of displaced people in Gaza city's Nuseirat refugee camp, according to local authorities.
In a statement, the Gaza-based Government Media Office said the Israeli army struck a UN agency for Palestinian refugees-run school in the Nuseirat refugee camp also leaving dozens of people injured.
It added that the Israeli army's relentless “massacres” in Gaza is proof that it continues the “genocide” of displaced Palestinians in the Gaza Strip.
The Israeli army admitted to hitting the UNRWA school in the Nuseirat refugee camp, claiming Hamas fighters were hiding inside.
Nearly eight months into the Israeli war, vast swathes of Gaza lay in ruins amid a crippling blockade of food, clean water, and medicine.

title: Putin Threatens To Send Arms To Countries That Could Attack Kyiv Allies
message:
Putin Threatens To Send Arms To Countries That Could Attack Kyiv's AlliesBy RFE/RL's Russian Service June 05, 2024Russian President Vladimir Putin warned on June 5 that Russia could provide advanced long-range weapons to Western adversaries in an "asymmetric" response to Ukrainian missile strikes deep into Russian territory.
The changes followed pleas from Ukraine to allow its forces to defend itself against attacks originating from Russian territory, and after pressure from some European leaders.
Putin warned that Western arms deliveries to Ukraine were "a very dangerous step," especially if donors are "controlling" use of the weapons.
He specifically warned Germany, saying that talk of it sending missiles capable of hitting targets on Russian territory "definitively destroys Russian-German relations."
On the use of nuclear weapons, Putin cited Russia's nuclear doctrine, which says if Russia's sovereignty and territorial integrity is threatened "we consider it possible for us to use all means at our disposal."

title: Putin Threatens To Supply Weapons To  Regions  For Retaliatory Strikes On Western Targets

Should that happen, Russia could supply long-range weapons to "regions" around the world where they could be used for strikes against Western targets, he threatened.
Photo by Kremlin Press Office/Handout/Anadolu via Getty ImagesUsing German-supplied weapons against Russian targets would mark a "dangerous step" on the part of Ukraine, Putin said, which could lead to "very serious problems."
So far, Russian officials have repeatedly lashed out over the use of NATO-member weapons against Russian targets, but have taken no discernable action.

title: D - Day at 80 : a legacy of air power
message:
That air power came in two forms: the long-range strategic bombing of industrial targets; and close-range tactical air support to ground troops.
Rather than providing tactical air support to troops on the beaches, the US Army Air Force opted to strike strategic industrial and transportation targets far away from the battlefield.
However, the Allies’ new air strategy also included new fighter tactics for the long-range air forces still flying over Germany.
D PLUS 80Eighty years after D-Day, allied air power is once again on display in Normandy, albeit in a much changed form.
The US Air Force says it has 14 aircraft operating from the Cherbourg-Maupertus airport for the D-Day commemoration.

title: Houthi rebels unveil solid - fuel missile that resembles Iranian hypersonic weapon
message:
The rebels fired the new Palestine missile, complete with a warhead painted like a Palestinian checkered scarf, at the southern Gulf of Aqaba port of Eilat in Israel on Monday.
Iranian media reported the launch of the Palestine and described it as locally manufactured, citing the Houthis.
Iran unveiled the missile last year and claimed it could reach Mach 15 — 15 times the speed of sound.
It described the missile’s range as up to 870 miles, which is a little short of Eilat from Houthi-controlled areas of Yemen, but the missile can be reconfigured to boost its range.
Hypersonic weapons, which fly at speeds higher than Mach 5, could pose crucial challenges to missile defence systems because of their speed and manoeuvrability.

title: Psychological warfare | Propaganda , Mind Games & Tactics
message:
psychological warfare, the use of propaganda against an enemy, supported by such military, economic, or political measures as may be required.
Although often looked upon as a modern invention, psychological warfare is of ancient origin.
Professionally managed psychological warfare is usually accompanied by the intelligence functions of propaganda analysis and audience information.
Psychological warfare is sometimes divided by its practitioners into levels reflecting the areas in and the times at which the military propaganda is expected to operate.
Tactical psychological warfare, on the other hand, implies a direct connection with combat operations, the commonest form being the surrender demand.

title: Airbus Unveils Uncrewed Wingman Concept To Operate With Eurofighters
message:
BERLIN–Airbus has lifted the veil on its concept for an autonomous collaborative combat aircraft that would accompany current combat aircraft into battle.
Wingman missions could include target reconnaissance as well as the destruction, electronic jamming and deception of enemy air defense systems.
“It is not being designed to be the perfect solution, but a good solution as early as possible that can be controlled with an enhanced Eurofighter,” Schoellhorn told reporters.
The initiative is analogous with French plans to develop an uncrewed combat aircraft like the Neuron unmanned combat air vehicle (UCAV) to operate alongside its Dassault Rafale.
Work on Wingman is currently an Airbus internally funded effort, with current spending in the low-double-digit millions of euros.

title: Masters of the Air : An intimate portrayal of America aerial warfare on Europe
message:
With principal photography taking place during Covid-19 and multiple complex air battle sequences to film, producers Tom Hanks, Gary Goetzman, and Steven Spielberg had a mammoth job at their hands.
Its storytelling transcended beyond the well-crafted battle sequences.
Through the eyes of Rosenthal, viewers were exposed to the horrors that the Holocaust inflicted along with the roots of Jews' Aliyah to Palestine.
In his first major role, he knocked it out of the park playing the complex and emotionally shaken Major Rosenthal.
Much like its predecessors Band of Brothers and Pacific, Masters of the Air has etched its place in contemporary warfare lore.

title: MBDA offers mini missiles for Rheinmetall Skyranger air - defense gun
message:

title: South Korea is making weapons faster and cheaper than the U . S .

Lead them straight and true; give strength to their arms, stoutness to their hearts, steadfastness in their faith.

title: My dad landed on Utah Beach on D - Day . His simple answer on how he did it offers lessons to Americans today
message:
My father's service on D-Day 80 years ago – the horror, the sheer hell of crossing the sand that morning – was all something of an abstraction to me.
His conception of duty, it was clear, consisted of an unwavering commitment to service above self.
It was service and sacrifice like my dad’s that led to his generation rightly being labeled "the greatest."
A key effect of pursuing service above self, however, is an appreciation of the service of others – and the service of those who came before.
As such it is always the time to do your duty and put service above self.

title: Why some Allied troops fighting in WW II were dubbed D - Day Dodgers
message:
For the Allies who had been fighting in Italy, they came to be known as D-Day Dodgers.
The origins of the term D-Day Dodgers is unclear, said Jeff Noakes, the Second World War historian at the Canadian War Museum in Ottawa.
Regardless of the origins, the term became well known and even sparked a song called, fittingly, D-Day Dodgers.
Noakes said the song makes fun of the fact the D-Day Dodgers are drinking and having fun while their Allied comrades are fighting elsewhere.

title: Armor : American M1 Tank Seeks Purpose
message:
The war in Ukraine has made it easier for the U.S. Army to get all the money wanted for upgrades to the American M1 tank force.
The army had already developed and scrutinized a new SEP (System Enhancement Package) update called SEP4 (or SEPV4) for its M1 tanks.
The M1 is an old design with the first of 3,273 M1 tanks produced in 1978.
So far over 10,000 American M1 tanks have been produced and most of them subsequently updated at least once, mainly in the 1990s.
The army is planning to maintain and upgrade its M1 tank fleet of 7,000 vehicles into the 2030s.

Today marks the 80th anniversary of D-Day, the historic World War II invasion of Nazi-occupied France by Allied forces.
The invasion, known for its scale and audacity, was a turning point in World War II, marking the beginning of the end for Adolf Hitler's reign over Western Europe.
On D-Day itself, 2,501 American troops were killed and more than 5,000 were wounded.
The subsequent Battle of Normandy resulted in the deaths of 73,000 Allied forces and left 153,000 wounded.

The centenarian, a former reconnaissance pilot with the Royal Canadian Air Force during World War Two, was involved in on D-Day and the Battle of Normandy.
In an interview from his care home at Toronto’s Sunnybrook Veterans Centre ahead of the D-Day anniversary, Rohmer spoke about the legacy of the war, returning to Normandy and the importance of remembrance.

message:
Ukraine Loses Up to 545 Soldiers in Fights With Russia's Battlegroup Zapad - MoDSputnik News20240605MOSCOW (Sputnik) - Russia's Battlegroup Zapad gained better ground over the past 24 hours, while Ukraine lost up to 545 soldiers in clashes, the Russian Ministry of Defense (MoD) said on Wednesday.
The Ukrainian armed forces also lost up to 125 servicemen and one tank in clashes with Russia's Battlegroup Vostok, according to the ministry.
"Ukraine's losses amounted to more than 360 Ukrainian troops [in clashes with Russia's Battlegroup Tsentr], two armored fighting vehicles, three motor vehicles, and one Anklav electronic warfare station," the ministry said, adding that the group also improved its tactical positions and repelled five counterattacks in the past day.
Russia's Battlegroup Sever also gained better ground and repelled seven counterattacks, while Kiev lost up to 290 soldiers in fights, the MoD noted.

title: Putin threatens to supply weapons to other countries to strike Western targets
message:
Putin threatens to supply weapons to third parties to strike Western targetsRussian President Vladimir Putin on June 5 said Moscow could supply advanced weapons to certain regions to enable strikes against "sensitive" Western targets as a response if Ukraine strikes Russia with Western arms.
Recently, the U.S. and Germany partially lifted a ban on Ukraine using certain weapons supplied by them to strike Russian territory.
Putin reiterated threats that Western countries could be "drawn into the war against Russia" and that such a step would mean their "direct participation in the war."
The Associated Press (AP) reported on June 5 on a supposedly first strike with the U.S.-supplied weapons inside Russia, which allegedly took place in "recent days."

title: Biden will shortly speak at the D - Day ceremony in Normandy
message:
US House Minority Leader Hakeem Jeffries on Thursday used the 80th anniversary of D-Day to push back on Donald Trump's claim that America is a "fascist state" following his recent felony conviction in New York.
"Well, America is a democracy ... and we have to fight to make sure that we can keep that going forward," Jeffries told Kasie Hunt from Normandy, France on "CNN This Morning."
"The fight against fascism was waged by our brave American heroes ... 80 years ago today, which began the liberation fight at the highest level against Nazi Germany, Hitler and fascism," he continued.
He urged that democracy "doesn't simply run on autopilot" and that today's events in Normandy, where the president is meeting with veterans, represent an "important recommitment to the principles of democracy."
Jeffries said he's "confident" that the American people will "pull together" in ways that are consistent with the founding principles of the United States.

title: Hezbollah : Lebanon prepared for full - scale war if  Israel  wills it
message:
Hezbollah: Lebanon prepared for full-scale war if 'Israel' wills itIran Press TVWednesday, 05 June 2024 2:04 AMA senior Hezbollah official warns that Israel will "face devastation and destruction" if it moves to expand the war against Lebanon.
Sheikh Naim Qassem, deputy chief of Lebanon's resistance movement, said on Tuesday that Hezbollah is not after the expansion of conflict with Israel but remains ready in the face of any imposed war.
He warned that any expansion of war by Israel will be met "with devastation and destruction" in the occupied territories.
The resistance movement has launched several operations against Israel in support of the Palestinians in the Gaza Strip.
Israel has also launched attacks on southern Lebanon over the past months, killing hundreds of civilians, including Hezbollah fighters.
